13:02.race_name: pricedup.bet Stayers' Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Handicap Hurdle (RE Initative)

runners.comment: Looks handicapped about right but was again placed here when close up over C&D in November
runners.name: Diamatiste
runners.spotlight: Looks handicapped about right but was again placed here when close up over C&D in November; unlikely to be far away.

runners.comment: Best of three hurdle runs was the latest at Newbury when beaten 13l in a 2m4f novice
runners.name: Crossgales King
runners.spotlight: Looked quite promising in bumpers and best of three hurdle runs was the latest at Newbury when beaten 13l in a 2m4f novice; this could be more his trip and it's his handicap debut.

runners.comment: Could improve for this longer trip but might not appreciate softening ground
runners.name: Call Me Legend
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner on good ground and had those conditions when third behind two exposed handicappers at Taunton (2m3f); could improve for this longer trip but might not appreciate softening ground.

runners.comment: Lightly raced and brings potential to his handicap career over this longer trip
runners.name: Gillespie
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; beaten about 17l in two maidens (2m3f/2m5f) but brings potential to his handicap career over this longer trip; respected.

runners.comment: Unpenalised when second at Hereford and now has a 6lb higher mark to deal with
runners.name: Tzarmix
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to win at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) but came up short when unpenalised at Hereford and now has a 6lb higher mark to deal with.

runners.comment: Has won here but ran moderately the last twice and he's back from a long absence
runners.name: Looking For Larry
runners.spotlight: A well-backed winner over 2m5f here on New Year's Day of last year (soft), his second run after a long absence; looked a bit of a handful afterwards, over fences and hurdles; returns with enough to prove.

runners.comment: Solid enough runs in defeat the last twice and likely to run well again
runners.name: Pipers Cross
runners.spotlight: Has won three times over hurdles and only 2lb higher than for the last of those over 3m2f; solid enough runs in defeat the last twice and likely to run well again.

runners.comment: Three chase wins here; pulled up last twice but on a favourable mark back over hurdles
runners.name: Bampton Star
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdler but a three-time chase winner and those wins all came here over 3m; has pulled up the last twice but returns to hurdling off a favourable mark.

runners.breeder: B G Hellyer & H D J Daly
runners.comment: He was behind Tzarmix at Hereford when having one of his better days
runners.name: Braganza Bay
runners.spotlight: On a good mark but he's wickedly inconsistent and was behind Tzarmix at Hereford when having one of his better days.

13:32.race_name: PricedUp The Jumps "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simon & Nicolas Simon &
runners.comment: Has shown ability in bumpers; bred to do better over jumps; remains open to progress
runners.name: A King Of Magic
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability in bumpers at Kempton for Tom Weston and Ffos Las for Paul Nicholls; remains open to progress, especially as he's bred to do better over jumps.

runners.comment: Placed in France but folded tamely at Newton Abbot for new yard
runners.name: Alidam
runners.spotlight: Placed a few times in France but needs to rebound, having folded tamely at Newton Abbot (2m5f) for new yard; drops back in trip.

runners.comment: Solid success in Irish point, beating a subsequent rules scorer; interesting contender
runners.name: Best Trump
runners.spotlight: Driven clear in Irish point (2m4f, heavy) last February, beating a subsequent rules scorer; siblings include a Grade 2 hurdle winner; interesting rules debutant.

runners.comment: Weak claims on his rules efforts
runners.name: Devilsrollthedice
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in last two attempts in Irish points; weak claims on his hurdles efforts, both over 2m3f at Chepstow.

runners.comment: Modest RPR in Taunton bumper
runners.name: Devon Paige
runners.spotlight: Midfield in Taunton bumper, recording a modest RPR; probably one for handicaps later on.

runners.comment: Again has frame possibilities but needs improvement to get off the mark
runners.name: Eton Mes
runners.spotlight: Couple of fourth-place finishes since switched to hurdles, latest over C&D (heavy); again has frame possibilities but needs improvement to open his account.

runners.comment: Solid third (form has substance) at Ffos Las in sole run for Nicky Henderson; big player
runners.name: Johnnys Jury
runners.owner: Blazing Blues Rc Hurlers On The Ditch
runners.spotlight: Absent since solid third in Ffos Las maiden hurdle (2m4f, soft; form has substance) a year ago in sole run for Nicky Henderson; sold for £75,000 ten days later; big player on the figures.

runners.comment: Hinted at ability in Ffos Las bumper but others have stronger claims
runners.name: Like A Dancer
runners.spotlight: Hinted at ability with sixth-place finish in Ffos Las bumper but never landed a blow; others have stronger claims on form.

runners.comment: Showed promise behind useful rival in Irish point in April 2024; interesting
runners.name: Limerick Star
runners.spotlight: Related to bumper/hurdle winners; showed promise, behind a useful rival who has franked the form, in Irish point in April 2024; one of two intriguing rules debutants in the field.

runners.comment: Folded tamely on British debut but is in excellent hands and may do better yet
runners.name: Lirone Du Seuil
runners.spotlight: Folded tamely at Wetherby (2m) on British debut, failing to back up the promise of his French hurdles effort; however, in excellent hands and may do better yet.

runners.comment: Has something to find on bumper form but is bred to do better over jumps
runners.name: Lord Virginia
runners.spotlight: Bumper form features a couple of fourth-place finishes, latest at Taunton; has something to find but is bred to do better over jumps.

runners.comment: Nicely bred and may yet confirm the promise of his Chepstow effort; hurdles debut
runners.name: Sailing By
runners.owner: J M Dare T Hamlin J W Snook
runners.spotlight: Possibly unsuited by change of tactics (helped to force the pace) at Exeter in latest bumper start; nicely bred and may yet confirm the promise of his Chepstow effort.

runners.comment: Needs improvement on her Leicester hurdles form
runners.name: Lady Dapple Rose
runners.spotlight: Form at Leicester (1m7f) since switched to hurdles comprises a second in small field then a lesser effort; needs improvement.

runners.comment: Could go well returned to Exeter, having recorded her best effort here
runners.name: Miss Tiara
runners.spotlight: Comes with risk, having bled from nose in two of her four runs; otherwise could go well returned to Exeter, having recorded her best effort here (2m5f).

runners.comment: Down the field in Chepstow bumper last April
runners.name: Moonlight Stride
runners.spotlight: Down the field in Chepstow bumper last April; the betting may show whether a bigger effort is anticipated.

runners.comment: Clear promise in sole French start and at Sandown; looks a winner waiting to happen
runners.name: Pourquoi Pas Papa
runners.spotlight: Has shown clear promise with second-place finishes in sole French start (subsequently sold for 200,000euros) and at Sandown, both on a soft surface and against his own age group; withdrawn twice in the last week due to good ground; looks a winner waiting to happen.

14:02.race_name: PricedUp Daily Racing Boosts Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: Margaret Treacy On His Own Stables
runners.comment: Stable debut when winning off 5lb lower at Chepstow and further progress is possible
runners.name: Toss Of A Coin
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on final two starts for Paul Nicholls but bounced back to form with 2m7f win at Chepstow (good to soft; first run after wind op) for new stable a month ago; raised 5lb but further progress is possible.

runners.comment: Cheltenham's fences got in the way last time and retains potential in this discipline
runners.name: First Confession
runners.spotlight: Won a point on heavy and a novice hurdle on good; hasn't really built on his good first run over fences (2m5f; ahead of Laganhill) but Cheltenham's fences got in the way last time and he retains plenty of potential in this discipline.

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: 2-4 over hurdles and positives to take from both chase runs; stayed 3m last time
runners.name: Laganhill
runners.spotlight: Won two of his four races over hurdles; beaten 16l and 9l in two handicap chases, though saw out the 3m well at Bangor last time and this lightly raced 8yo surely has more to offer.

runners.comment: There's good reason to believe he can improve on his 5l defeat at Aintree
runners.name: El Granjero
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who was runner-up in his first chase (three runs back) and shaped nicely after a break on his second attempt at Aintree (3m1f, good to soft) when only 5l off the winner; stable has found some form since and Ned Fox takes off 5lb; player.

runners.comment: Has performed okay in his two handicap chases without genuinely threatening
runners.name: Saint Anapolino
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler at up to 2m5f; has performed okay in his two handicap chases without genuinely threatening, over 2m3f and 3m1f; needs more.

runners.comment: Left clear when a 13l winner at Doncaster but might have won anyway; 6lb higher
runners.name: Silver Thorn
runners.spotlight: Promising novice hurdler who jumped a lot better in his second chase at Doncaster (3m, good to soft; 6lb lower) where he was left clear late on; would probably have won anyway; hard to knock.

runners.comment: Held on gamely to make a winning seasonal/chase debut at Taunton; just 3lb higher
runners.name: Wicked Thoughts
runners.spotlight: Held on gamely to make a winning seasonal/chase debut at Taunton (2m7f, good to firm; won a bumper on soft) in late November; only 3lb higher here and this 7yo is having only his tenth career start.

runners.comment: Respected on hurdle form; made mistakes on chase debut but that was at Sandown
runners.name: Tommy The Tank
runners.spotlight: Did well as a novice hurdler and beat Wicked Thoughts by 13l in a Hereford maiden (3m1f); he'll need to jump better than was the case on his chase debut a month ago but that was at Sandown; not dismissed.

14:32.race_name: Download The PricedUp App Handicap Chase (Challenger Staying Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Last two runs could be forgiven but he has top weight in a competitive race
runners.name: Mount Tempest
runners.spotlight: Won at Worcester (2m4f, good to soft) in September on third start for this yard; feasible excuses for subsequent non-completions as fast ground may not have suited at Chepstow and then ran over the Grand National fences; could run a lot better here but he's got top weight in a competitive race.

runners.comment: Early blunder ended any realistic hopes of a successful chase debut at Warwick
runners.name: Spirits Bay
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs P Carter J A B Old M Sanders
runners.spotlight: His third win over hurdles in October (2m1f, good to soft) and an early blunder ended any realistic hopes of a successful chase debut at Warwick for which he was favourite; can be given another chance.

runners.comment: Returned in fairly good form over hurdles and should make a chaser; cheekpieces added
runners.name: Into The Park
runners.spotlight: Promising hurdler when winning twice in early 2024; had some lengthy breaks since then but nearly won at Uttoxeter in October (2m4f, good; prefers softer) and it wasn't a bad run at Sandown; should make a chaser and cheekpieces are added; respected.

runners.comment: Off since an impressive chase debut 11 months ago; goes well fresh and very unexposed
runners.name: Big City Roller
runners.spotlight: An 8yo who won a point and has raced only three times under rules; made an impressive start to his chase career in a Bangor handicap (2m4f, heavy) 11 months ago after 15 months off; off since but evidently able fresh and could still be ahead of his mark after an 8lb rise.

runners.comment: Figures of 1121 since fitted with cheekpieces; dug deep here last time off 4lb lower
runners.name: Good Friday Fairy
runners.spotlight: Figures of 1121 since fitted with cheekpieces and showed admirable resilience to prevail over C&D in November (good to soft); off another career-high mark now (4lb higher) but firmly enters the reckoning.

runners.comment: Probably has little margin for error off this mark but has each-way hopes
runners.name: Denemethy
runners.spotlight: Consistent since sent chasing (1-7) and left the impression that his run here in November would bring him on; probably has little margin for error off this mark but has each-way hopes.

runners.comment: Had some luck on his side when winning at Ludlow but he's only 2lb higher
runners.name: Followcato
runners.spotlight: A good bit went his way when making most at Ludlow (2m4f, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces) but it was a likeable display and he's only 2lb higher; considered.

runners.comment: Back over the right trip but replacing cheekpieces with blinkers casts some doubts
runners.name: Pilsdon Pen
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-7 over fences when a narrow winner at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft) and didn't stay 3m1f next time; could go well back over a better trip, though he's usually seen in cheekpieces and now goes in blinkers (tried once on the Flat and ran poorly).

runners.comment: Well beaten in two chases; down the weights though and slower ground would help
runners.name: Boyles Hill
runners.spotlight: Point and three-time hurdles winner but beaten a long way in handicap chases over 2m and 2m7f; getting back on slower ground could help should conditions go that way and he's dropped down the weights.

runners.comment: C&D winner is on a competitive mark and returned to form with a third at Wincanton
runners.name: Flash Gorcombe
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 6-27 over fences and returned to form when a 7.5l third at Wincanton (2m4f, soft); this C&D winner is on a competitive mark.

runners.comment: Consistency isn't his strong point and today's blinkers are new
runners.name: Iris Des Issards
runners.spotlight: Ran okay back over hurdles at Taunton (3m, good to firm; effective on soft) but consistency isn't his strong point and today's blinkers are new; bit risky, despite the booking of Harry Cobden.

runners.comment: His fourth of 17 here in November is flanked by two much lesser efforts
runners.name: Moorland Rambler
runners.spotlight: Fourth of 17 here in November (2m, good; effective on softer) but remote finishes on either side of that and he's hard to predict.

runners.comment: Good run when last seen in August and he does seem best caught fresh
runners.name: Robbers Bridge
runners.spotlight: Off since August but that was a good run at Fontwell (2m5f, good to soft) in finishing a close third after racing up with the pace; this three-time winner does seem best caught fresh; respected.

runners.comment: Third in a farcical race on handicap debut and was then tailed off at Wincanton
runners.name: Its A Breeze
runners.spotlight: No improvement when remote third in farcical race on seasonal/handicap debut at Plumpton (2m4f, good) and then finished tailed off at Wincanton; in a top yard but the positives stop there.

runners.comment: Needs a return to form as when third last time he was beaten 23l; visor is new
runners.name: Shuil Ceoil
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come on soft ground; needs a return to form as when third last time he was beaten 23l; visor replaces cheekpieces.

runners.breeder: T Vigneron & Messrs M & L Lochin
runners.comment: Twice disappointed since his successful debut, latterly when 40-1 for handicap debut
runners.name: Iamcelestialgift
runners.owner: DL Adams JA Adams & G McPherson
runners.spotlight: Won a Carlisle maiden in April 2025 on his belated debut; since then he's finished well behind in novice/handicap company at about 3m; hard to be at all confident.

runners.comment: Absent since finishing third in a Chepstow maiden in March that lacked depth
runners.name: Benignitas
runners.spotlight: Point winner; 0-9 on the Flat and 0-2 over hurdles; absent since finishing third in a Chepstow maiden in March that lacked depth.

runners.comment: 4lb higher than when 11l second at Uttoxeter; remote 3rd on heavy at Ffos Las on Thursday
runners.name: Getaway With You
runners.spotlight: Winning run came to an end when no match for a front-runner at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy; drier ground fine) three weeks ago and he was a remote third on heavy going at Ffos Las on Thursday.

runners.comment: Raised in trip for this handicap debut and worth a market check
runners.name: Directly
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in a bumper but down the field in his first three races over hurdles, though the last two were at Ascot and Cheltenham; raised in trip for this handicap debut and worth a market check.

runners.comment: Now goes handicapping with a tongue-tie fitted and entitled to show more
runners.name: Largy Panic
runners.spotlight: Second in an Irish point; uncompetitive in 1m7f-2m4f hurdles but now goes handicapping with a tongue-tie fitted and entitled to show more.

runners.comment: A recent winner but beaten fair and square off this mark over Christmas
runners.name: Olivia Kate
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late David M Richards
runners.spotlight: Won well at Leicester but she was 7lb higher and without the benefit of Ned Fox's 5lb claim when beaten fair and square off this mark over Christmas; might be vulnerable once more.

runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Useful on the Flat but lost his way and quiet so far over hurdles; handicap debut
runners.name: Victory Shout
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat when at his best but lost his way in that scene and it's been a quiet start over hurdles; handicaps should see him in a better light but risks attached.

runners.comment: A reasonable run last time on first completion since returning from a layoff
runners.name: Prairie Diamond
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m4f handicap at Wincanton two seasons ago off 3lb lower; a reasonable run last time on first completion since returning from a layoff; possibilities if building on that.

runners.comment: Latest third his best run for a while but stamina for this far remains unproven
runners.name: Storming Nelson
runners.spotlight: It's been a struggle in handicaps since winning his maiden here on New Year's Day of 2024 but produced his best run since then when a close third at Fontwell a month ago (2m1f, heavy) on second run after wind surgery; stamina for this far remains unproven.

runners.comment: Taunton winner in March; went off 50-1 on her belated return in November and was pulled up
runners.name: Whatmakes Honey B
runners.spotlight: Won a Taunton handicap last March (2m3f, good) but still went off 50-1 on her belated return in November and was pulled up (lost both front shoes); others preferred.

runners.comment: Won in Ireland but mostly disappointing since arriving in Britain; blinkers tried
runners.name: Weseekherthere
runners.spotlight: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner in 2023 for Gordon Elliott; mostly disappointing since arriving in Britain and replacing cheekpieces for blinkers needs to trigger something.

runners.comment: A number of good runs since handicapping and there were excuses last time at Windsor
runners.name: Locked Down Lad
runners.spotlight: Point bumper winner; a number of good runs in defeat since handicapping and was second in a big field at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) before an excusable defeat at Windsor where he slipped on one of the bends; worth considering, though would have questions to answer on soft ground.

runners.comment: Race didn't set up for him last time and today's drop in trip offset by the stiff track
runners.name: Tom Taggle
runners.spotlight: Raced in last and couldn't land a blow when beaten 7l at Taunton (3m, good to firm) the last time, finishing behind Iris Des Issards; his only win was over nearly 3m but he's back over shorter on a stiff track; respected.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Ma & Mr Marc Dumont
runners.comment: Point/hurdles winner; yet to win over fences; decent run over 1m7f last season; a possible
runners.name: Risk De Pluie
runners.spotlight: Point winner; won a Fontwell novice hurdle on rules debut in January 2024 (2m3f, soft); yet to win over fences but a few decent runs, including when second at Wincanton last February (1m7f, soft); tried over longer trips since (below par over 3m1f latest); this stiff 2m1f could be ideal.

runners.comment: Dual chase winner but has been hurdling recently; a bit to prove now back over fences
runners.name: Wewillgowithplanb
runners.spotlight: Has won two chases (2m/2m2f) but failed to complete on last two runs over fences and has since run over hurdles; bit to prove now back chasing.

runners.comment: Five-time chase winner; good 2nd on reappearance (2m4f); drops in trip; worth considering
runners.name: Royal Mer
runners.spotlight: Five-time chase winner; good second to an unexposed winner at Wincanton on reappearance (2m4f, soft); drops in trip; worth considering.

runners.comment: All five wins have been at Plumpton; headgear changed after poor reappearance run
runners.name: Alto Alto
runners.spotlight: All five wins, four of them over fences, have been over 2m/2m1f at Plumpton, latest last February (2m1f, soft; visor on for first time); headgear changed after poor reappearance run in November; a bit to prove away from Plumpton.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Jc Laisis
runners.comment: In good form over fences and hurdles with cheekpieces for this yard; should go well again
runners.name: Haas Boy
runners.spotlight: Has been in good form for present yard since cheekpieces were fitted, winning a handicap chase here and a handicap hurdle at Newton Abbot; runner-up over hurdles on last two starts and interesting now back over fences.

runners.comment: Three wins last season, the 2nd over C&D; in decent form this term; each-way chance
runners.name: Passing Kate
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late David M Richards
runners.spotlight: Three wins last season, including a handicap chase over C&D in February; runner-up on all three starts this term; each-way chance.

runners.comment: Won h'cap hurdle for Henry de Bromhead before £5,500 sale; tongue-tie on for chase debut
runners.name: Love Me
runners.spotlight: Won a Navan handicap hurdle for Henry de Bromhead; bought for £5,500; fair form both starts for present yard, but a bit to prove now going chasing; tongue-tie now tried on first run since wind surgery.

runners.comment: Two chase wins in 2024; good second on final start last term; stable going well; chance
runners.name: Bonza Boy
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins over 2m3f in March/April 2024; good second over 2m3f on last of three starts last season; below par on reappearance but should come on for that run.

runners.comment: Three wins last season but has been disappointing this term; plenty to prove at present.
runners.name: Paddy In The Caddy
runners.spotlight: Did well with three wins over fences last season (2m, good to soft) but has been very disappointing this term (with headgear last twice); plenty to prove at present.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish; 0-11; fair fourth in novice h'cap hurdle last time; best watched on chase debut
runners.name: W B Easy
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; 11-race maiden; fair fourth in a 2m2f novice handicap hurdle on second run for new yard here last time; wind op since; best watched on chase debut.

runners.comment: Both wins have been over 2m5f at Hereford, latest on reappearance last month; a possible
runners.name: Kingcormac
runners.spotlight: Both chase wins, including on reappearance last month, have been over 2m5f at Hereford (good to soft); could go well again.

16:05.race_name: PricedUp Supports British Racing Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Well related and cost 155,000euros as a 3yo; an interesting newcomer
runners.name: Blackswan dOroux
runners.spotlight: 155,000euros 3yo; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Blueking D'Oroux (smart 1m7f-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Path D'Oroux (bumper and useful 2m hurdle/chase); dam French 2m1f hurdle winner; interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: This is a belated debut at six but has an appealing pedigree and in a top yard
runners.name: Bold Step
runners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-brother to winners Kincardine (bumper/2m hurdle) and Steal A March (useful 2m5f-3m hurdle); dam bumper winner, half-sister to 2m5f/2m7f hurdle winner No Trumps; this is a belated debut at six but has an appealing pedigree.

runners.comment: Ran well at Chepstow, 7l behind a nice prospect who has since followed up
runners.name: Crystal Orchard
runners.spotlight: Degrees of promise to take from both runs, last time at Chepstow (soft) finishing 7l behind a nice prospect who has since followed up at Aintree; now has some experience behind him and should run well.

runners.comment: Only four ran and was no match for the winner at Uttoxeter in November
runners.name: Eastern Fire
runners.spotlight: Only four ran and was no match for the winner at Uttoxeter in November (heavy; 5-1); likely that he'll need more here but that's feasible.

runners.comment: Beaten 6l in his Irish point and about double that distance at Hereford
runners.name: Final Surprise
runners.spotlight: Bought for £40,000 after a 6l defeat in an Irish point; beaten about double that distance at Hereford but again ran okay; others preferred on this occasion.

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Cost £2,000 as a 3yo and his yard is 1-45 in bumpers the last five seasons; opposable
runners.name: Gospel Moon
runners.spotlight: Cost £2,000 as a 3yo and his yard is 1-45 in bumpers the last five seasons; opposable.

runners.comment: 16-1 and barely sighted on good to soft at Newbury two months ago
runners.name: Governors Island
runners.spotlight: 16-1 and barely sighted on good to soft at Newbury two months ago; can only be watched after that debut.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Newton Abbot (good to soft) and here (soft) so has ability
runners.name: Im Wide Awake
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Newton Abbot (good to soft) and here (soft) so has ability; however, this looks a better race than last time.

runners.comment: Suffered a heavy defeat at Newton Abbot where he was friendless in the betting
runners.name: Keepsoldieringon
runners.spotlight: Suffered a heavy defeat at Newton Abbot where he was friendless in the betting.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Cerdeval Mme Valerie Aumont Mr
runners.comment: 95,000euros 3yo and a half-brother to two smart jumpers; dam French bumper winner
runners.name: Le Cold Grey
runners.spotlight: 95,000euros 3yo; half-brother to winners Gaillard Du Mesnil (1m5f AQPS Flat and high-class 2m4f-3m6f hurdle/chase) and Hardi Du Mesnil (French 2m1f hurdle); dam 1m3f/1m4f AQPS Flat winner; of obvious interest given his connections.

runners.comment: £24,000 3yo; first foal out of a bumper and 2m1f-2m7f hurdle winner
runners.name: Malinaero
runners.spotlight: £24,000 3yo; first foal out of a bumper and 2m1f-2m7f hurdle winner; stable's bumper newcomers are usually best watched.

runners.comment: Remote third in an Irish point but behind two horses who have shown promise under rules
runners.name: Quickkick
runners.spotlight: Remote third in an Irish point but behind two horses who have shown promise under rules for powerful yards; could have a good future ahead of him.

runners.comment: £32,000 brother to point winner out of a well-related winning mare; bred to have a future
runners.name: Valiant Soldier
runners.spotlight: £32,000 3yo; fifth foal; brother to point winner Cherry Brave; dam bumper winner/placed in 2m hurdles, half-sister to winners Teescomponents Lad (useful 2m3f-3m1f hurdle) and Tesscomponentsyess (bumper and 2m3f/2m4f hurdle/chase); bred to have a future.

runners.comment: Bred to win races and trainer has had a couple of bumper winners
runners.name: Fountains Gala
runners.spotlight: Sister to winners Fountains Windfall (smart bumper and 2m1f-3m hurdle/chase), Fountains Blossom (bumper/2m4f hurdle), Fountains Blenhein (bumper and 2m3f/2m6f hurdle) and Fountainspinklady (bumper); dam bumper/2m6f-3m hurdle winner; bred to win races and trainer has had a couple of bumper winners.

runners.comment: 10,000euros foal; first foal; dam bumper winner, half-sister to point winner Out Of Africa
runners.name: Mortal Coil
runners.spotlight: 10,000euros foal; first foal; dam bumper winner, half-sister to point winner Out Of Africa; stable has had many newcomers run well on their debuts in bumpers.

13:27.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Dual course winner for David O'Meara in 2024 but has regressed and needs a major revival
runners.name: Natzor
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner for David O'Meara in 2024 but has regressed and was tailed off four weeks ago; falling in the weights but needs a major revival.

runners.comment: 0-6 on AW; well treated on old form but probably opposable after 208 days off
runners.name: Clansman
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: Six-time turf winner at up to 1m7f but 0-6 on AW; well treated on old form but not at his best in 2025 and probably opposable after 208 days off.

runners.comment: Good second at Wolverhampton in September; third over hurdles last month; possibilities
runners.name: Bunker Bay
runners.spotlight: Just 1-26 Flat and jumps, the win coming over 11.4f at Yarmouth in July 2023, but has possibilities on his second over this trip at Wolverhampton in September, and he was third over hurdles last month; wears cheekpieces for the first time; more appealing than many.

runners.comment: Runner-up for third time on the trot at Chelmsford last week; should be involved again
runners.name: Cardinal Point
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Cxxi And Partner
runners.spotlight: Most consistent since returned to the AW in September and she was runner-up for the third time on the trot at Chelmsford (1m6f) last week; has run well for Joe Bradnam; should be in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: 0-16 in handicaps but better than result at Southwell latest; capable of another big run
runners.name: King Chaos
runners.spotlight: 0-16 in handicaps but he's knocking at the door, doing well in the circumstances when a never-nearer fourth of 12 at Southwell (1m3f) 12 days ago; shapes as if he'll stay this longer trip; capable of another big run.

runners.comment: Unreliable these days but goes well here and can't be discounted after five months off
runners.name: Brunello Breeze
runners.spotlight: Stablemate of Clansman; all three wins have come here, including over this distance; tends to miss the break these days and has been disappointing on his last three starts, but he's back below his last winning mark and impossible to discount back at Newcastle after five months off.

runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox
runners.comment: Arrives in form with two good placed efforts over C&D; should be on the premises again
runners.name: Royal Blaze
runners.spotlight: Does most of his racing here and arrives in form with two good placed efforts over C&D; has a reasonable strike-rate (3-21) in the context of this race and likely to be on the premises again.

runners.comment: Signs of emerging from a lull when fourth over C&D 11 days ago; might be the answer
runners.name: Annandale
runners.spotlight: Showed signs of emerging from a lull when fourth of nine over C&D 11 days ago, finishing less than 1l behind Royal Blaze; two of his three AW wins have come at Newcastle, and he's now 3lb below his last winning mark; might be the answer.

runners.comment: Little promise of late but her mark is falling and this step back up in trip should suit
runners.name: Shifter
runners.spotlight: 1-14 on AW, well below par over 1m this winter since returning from an absence; carries obvious risks but at least her mark is falling and she may prove suited by this step back up in distance.

13:57.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Well-bred son of Frankel, representing a leading stable; very interesting on paper
runners.name: Asia Force
runners.spotlight: By Frankel; dam 1m/1m2f winner (including AW Listed; RPR 107), half-sister to winners Little Rose (1m2f) and Factual Fact (bumper), out of unraced close relative of German 1m2f Listed winner Promesse De L'Aube; bred to be useful and represents a leading stable; very interesting on paper.

runners.comment: Twice-raced; improvement required but at least this step up in distance should suit
runners.name: Choir Boy
runners.spotlight: Fifth on both his outings (1m/7f) so far, the first one in Ireland for Aidan O'Brien; needs to improve and that's possible, with today's step up in distance likely to suit judged on his pedigree.

runners.comment: Better effort last month when fourth at Lingfield; open to further progress
runners.name: Level Look
runners.spotlight: Much better effort in December when fading into fourth of 12 at Lingfield (1m; 200-1) just before Christmas; open to further progress and bred to stay 1m2f; not ruled out.

runners.breeder: J Hanly A Stroud And T Stewart
runners.comment: Improved when second over this trip at Chelmsford last month; sets the standard on form
runners.name: New Bay Star
runners.spotlight: Gelded after his first three starts and he showed some improvement when second of eight at Chelmsford (1m2f; 3-1) last month, making much of the running; that sets the standard on form and he's the one to beat in first-time cheekpieces.

14:27.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: Followed Chelmsford win with Wolverhampton third; form has substance; should go well
runners.name: Onyeisi
runners.spotlight: Improved form upped to 1m2f when winning Chelmsford nursery in November, and he ran respectably when third at Wolverhampton (9.4f) the following month; unlike most of his rivals, his form has substance and he should go well despite top weight.

runners.comment: Beaten at least 8l all four starts (5f-7f); stamina to prove over this much longer trip
runners.name: Petes Diamond
runners.spotlight: Beaten at least 8l all four starts (5f-7f), visored when sixth of nine on handicap debut at Southwell on latest; may still be unexposed but has stamina to prove over this much longer trip (mixed messages from pedigree).

runners.comment: Modest at best in three 2yo runs but this significant step up in distance promises to suit
runners.name: Riddikulus
runners.spotlight: Modest form at best in three runs towards the end of 2025, never-nearer sixth of 13 over 6f here (125-1) on last of them; needs a surge of improvement but may get that over this much longer distance as she's bred to be well suited by 1m2f+; worth monitoring in the market.

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Close fifth at Wolverhampton last time; today's longer trip an unknown but not ruled out
runners.name: Trust No One
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but his first outing for Lemos De Souza was a close fifth of eight at Wolverhampton (8.6f) ten days ago; not certain to be suited by today's extra yardage but he's impossible to rule out.

runners.comment: Beat just two rivals in four 2yo runs; needs marked improvement for this much longer trip
runners.name: Sunday Sinatra
runners.spotlight: Beat just two rivals in four races (6f/7f) last year, although he was hampered at the start under an inexperienced rider on latest; hopes of improvement are pinned on this much longer trip.

runners.comment: Kept on well when fourth at Wolverhampton, suggesting she'll stay this far; possibilities
runners.name: Family Values
runners.owner: J Sarkar D Sarkar O Sarkar & D Sarkar
runners.spotlight: Has achieved just poor form but her close fourth of nine on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f) last month was a step in the right direction; the blinkers she wore then are retained and the way she kept on suggests she'll have no problem with another step up in distance; possibilities.

14:57.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands B-D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Beaten at odds-on over C&D last time but worth another chance to build on debut run
runners.name: Alba Gu Brath
runners.spotlight: Bred to be useful and he made an encouraging start when second over this trip at Kempton in December; beaten at odds-on over C&D ten days later but the winner is a promising type and it's unlikely he'll meet anything of that calibre today; worth another chance to build on his debut run.

runners.comment: Run off his feet over 5f last time but open to progress now stepping up in distance
runners.name: Five Cay
runners.spotlight: Similar form when fourth over 6f here and 7f at Lingfield, before being run off his feet over 5f at Wolverhampton; related to several winners over 1m+ and open to progress now stepping up in distance.

runners.comment: Made frame first two starts and had possible excuse last time; real chance if staying trip
runners.name: Viking Glory
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on his first two outings, runner-up over 7f on this course on the second of them; only fifth of ten here (6f) last time but he was possibly at a disadvantage in racing towards the centre of the track; the tongue-strap goes on today; real chance if staying this longer trip.

runners.comment: Weak in market and tailed off over C&D last month, finishing well behind Alba Gu Brath
runners.name: Red House
runners.spotlight: Weak in the market (80-1) and tailed off over C&D on debut last month, finishing well behind Alba Gu Brath.

runners.comment: Green when last of ten on debut here 11 days ago; may improve good deal for the experience
runners.name: Freezing Havana
runners.spotlight: Lost many lengths at the start when last of ten on debut here (6f; 18-1) 11 days ago; hard to fancy on that bare form but today's longer trip should be in her favour and she may improve a good deal for the experience.

15:30.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 At BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Shaped quite well on AW debut when third at Chelmsford; up in trip; not ruled out
runners.name: Mostar Dreams
runners.owner: J Fyffe A Edmondson & L McGurty
runners.spotlight: 3-21 on turf; shaped quite well on AW debut when third of seven at Chelmsford (7f; 3-1 joint-favourite) six weeks ago; moves into unknown territory trip-wise but her pedigree gives hope that she'll stay; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Came from last to first at Wolverhampton last month; up 6lb but has to be respected
runners.name: Enola Grey
runners.spotlight: Usually gives her running on the AW and she came from last to first when winning at Wolverhampton (7f) last month; more required off a 6lb higher mark but this C&D winner has to be respected.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who won Wolverhampton novice last time; unexposed; handicap debut
runners.name: Great Mates
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who justified favouritism in Wolverhampton novice (8.6f) seven weeks ago, leading inside the final 1f; doesn't look thrown in for handicap debut but she's unexposed and needs taking seriously.

runners.comment: 0-9 for this yard and beat only one home on New Year's Day; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Donna Nook
runners.spotlight: Yet to win in nine attempts for her current handler and she beat only one home over C&D on New Year's Day; steadily falling in the weights but needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Hasn't built on encouraging stable debut; hopes are pinned on visor having positive effect
runners.name: Soho Square
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage type who won over 7f here last spring and made an encouraging start for this yard when second at Southwell in October; however, she has not built on that form and she folded tamely here last time; hopes are pinned on a first-time visor having a positive effect.

runners.comment: Two wins in autumn; fifth at Wolverhampton latest and better off with winner; big chance
runners.name: Electric Avenue
runners.spotlight: Better than ever in the autumn, winning twice (7f/1m) on this course; faded only late on when fifth to Enola Grey at Wolverhampton last month; meets that rival on 6lb better terms and returning to Newcastle can only be a positive; very solid candidate.

16:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Losing run up to 21; drops to this level for the first time but still has a bit to find
runners.name: Bossy Parker
runners.spotlight: Won two Wolverhampton handicaps (7f, Tapeta) at the start of 2024 but 0-21 since; drops to this level for the first time but still has a bit to find on these terms.

runners.comment: 0-13; makes her stable debut after 111 days off; watch market
runners.name: Eagles Whistle
runners.spotlight: 0-13 when trained in Ireland; makes her stable debut after 111 days off and the market may indicate what is expected.

runners.comment: Won a couple of similar contests over C&D last year and third in a 0-60 handicap last time
runners.name: Elettaria
runners.spotlight: Won a couple of similar contests over C&D last year and ran well to finish third of nine behind two more prominently ridden rivals in a 0-60 handicap here 11 days ago; major player back at this level.

runners.comment: 0-14 and modest in two starts for this yard; down the pecking order
runners.name: Esque Elegance
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in 12 starts in Ireland and no improvement in two starts since returning for this yard in October, the latest over C&D; down the pecking order despite the drop in grade.

runners.comment: Has a little bit to find, but was successful the last time he raced down at this level
runners.name: Evoluir
runners.spotlight: Was successful the last time he raced down at this level at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) 11 months ago and finished a creditable fourth of 12 in a 0-55 handicap there last month; has a little bit to find, but still more appealing than many.

runners.comment: Dual course winner as a 2yo; drops into a 0-50 for the first time; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Laurens Dream
runners.spotlight: Won a couple of 0-60 nurseries here (6f/7f) in November 2024; 0-16 since, but has only once had another go over this far in that period and drops into a 0-50 for the first time; interesting with cheekpieces given a go.

runners.comment: Three course wins in 2024, but needs to fare better than in both runs since returning
runners.name: Marcello Si
runners.spotlight: All three wins came here (7f/1m) in 2024 including two handicaps; best effort since when third of 12 in a similar contest to this over C&D last March, but will need to fare better than in both outings since returning in November.

runners.comment: 0-8 and well beaten on AW debut over C&D three weeks ago; others preferred
runners.name: Our Nicola
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden whose best effort was when third of eight at Musselburgh (7f,good) in August, but twice well beaten since including on AW debut over C&D three weeks ago; down in grade, but others still preferred.

runners.comment: Drops into a 0-50 for the first time, but not easy to predict and losing run is up to 26
runners.name: Rory
runners.spotlight: Three course wins have come over 5f/6f, but he stays further; capable if they go hard enough up front and drops into a 0-50 for the first time, but not easy to predict and losing run is up to 26.

runners.comment: 0-6 and finished behind a couple of these last time; hard to make a case for
runners.name: Sogannie
runners.spotlight: Not beaten as far as she had been previously in a 0-60 handicap over C&D 11 days ago, but was still only seventh of nine and finished behind a couple of these; hard to make a case for.

runners.comment: One of those most suited by the race conditions but last three efforts need improving upon
runners.name: The Gay Blade
runners.spotlight: Winner of six races including one over 6f here; one of those most suited by the race conditions, but his last three efforts will need improving upon.

runners.comment: 0-5 and has beaten a total of one rival in last three starts
runners.name: Wee Nan
runners.spotlight: Some ability when fourth of nine in a 6f novice here in August, but has beaten a total of one rival in three starts since (underwent wind surgery before latest outing).

16:35.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap

runners.comment: Front-runner who made all at Southwell on Sunday; winner here too; should go well again
runners.name: Arlington
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who gained a third win over Southwell's straight 5f when well handled by Matthew Lloyd Slater on Sunday; has winning form here too and should go well again, although he's worse off at the weights with third-placed Bishop's Glory and fourth-placed Okami.

runners.comment: Shaped nicely when fourth at Southwell; now returns to C&D of sole win; leading contender
runners.name: What What What
runners.spotlight: Back to the mark of his sole win, which came over C&D, and he shaped nicely when fourth at Southwell on Sunday, fading over 6f; should be suited by this return to the minimum trip; leading contender.

runners.comment: Off mark at 16th attempt over C&D on New Year's Day; should make another bold bid
runners.name: Little Mi Mi
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 16th attempt when always prominent over C&D on New Year's Day, with Henery Hawk and Invincible Annice safely held; up 5lb but she's at the top of her game and should make another bold bid.

runners.comment: 0-13 but shaped well after break when fourth over 6f here; needs taking seriously
runners.name: Auntie Jo
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden; encouraging fourth over 6f here eight days ago, fading after eight months off; may well come on for the run and is at least as effective over 5f; needs taking seriously.

runners.comment: Won over C&D in November but no better than eighth in four runs since
runners.name: Invincible Annice
runners.spotlight: Won off 2lb lower over C&D in November but no better than eighth in four runs since and well held by Little Mi Mi on New Year's Day.

runners.comment: Four wins here; below par of late but had excuse last time and could bounce back
runners.name: Henery Hawk
runners.spotlight: Four wins here but below par on his last three starts; however, he shaped a bit better than the result suggests from a low draw when sixth to Little Mi Mi over C&D eight days ago; not inconceivable he could bounce back.

runners.comment: C&D winner on second start for this yard; creditable fourth last time; remains of interest
runners.name: Okami
runners.spotlight: Has had just three runs for Paul Midgley, making all over C&D on second of them and running creditably when fourth to Arlington at Southwell five days ago; may still have scope from this sort of mark and he's high on the list.

runners.comment: Ran creditably back at 5f when third at Southwell; big player off unchanged mark
runners.name: Bishops Glory
runners.spotlight: Has done most of his racing over 6f/7f but ran creditably back at the minimum trip when third to Arlington at Southwell on Sunday; has winning form here and looks a big player off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: On 17-race losing run; second over C&D in December but then only fifth at Wolverhampton
runners.name: Desert Master
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.spotlight: On a 17-race losing sequence; chased home Okami over C&D in December but was then only fifth at Wolverhampton; others preferred.

runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: Runner-up at Wolverhampton on Tuesday; non-runner at Chelmsford on Thursday
runners.name: Tommytwohoots
runners.spotlight: Went off 25-1 but ran creditably when runner-up at Wolverhampton on Tuesday on second run since re-joining this yard; this race looks stronger; non-runner at Chelmsford (6.30) on Thursday evening.
